dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 5832 IH: Keep the Watchdogs Running Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Connolly introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Accountability

form.official-title: To authorize Inspectors General to continue operations during a lapse in appropriations, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Keep the Watchdogs Running Act.

section.header: Inspector General oversight during lapse in appropriations
section.text: Subsection (g) of section 6 of the Inspector General Act of 1978 (5 U.S.C. App.) is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law and in addition to any other authority, during a lapse in appropriations, an Inspector General may incur obligations in advance of appropriationsâ€”

subparagraph.text: for such amounts as may be necessary and at a rate for operations and under the authority and conditions as provided in the most recently enacted appropriations Acts; and
to perform the duties of the Office with respect to any program and operation of the establishment that continues during the lapse in appropriations.
